result.execSummary:
The defendant Selena E Roder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Selena E Roder is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Selena E Roder was found guilty of Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain GED or high school diploma or equivalency.

Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Defn eligible for early termination once high school diploma is received with agent approval and no new charges.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
Hearing set on Ability to Pay
$67 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Dept of Corrections.  $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted.

2:22 PM Defendant Selena E Roder in court with Attorney Nancy L. Moore.  ADA Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 3.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #4 . 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #3   
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 1 year. Defn eligible for early termination once high school diploma is received with agent approval and no new charges.

CONDITIONS:
-Obtain GED or high school diploma or equivalency
-Provide DNA sample
-Restitution: (State has filed Order. Defn has no objection to amount but requests a hearing on the ability to pay)
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #3
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due on probation.

-Bond posted to be applied to restitution, remainder to fines/cc. Return any balance to poster. 

-The Court orders DNA sample

-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights
